{{Quote|This isn't Winterfell, boy. Your sister took over command of your eldest brother's ship, after your new father killed him.|Balon Greyjoy to Theon|The Night Lands}}

'''Rodrik Greyjoy''' is an unseen character in ''[[Game of Thrones]]''. He is deceased when the events of the series begin and is not expected to appear in the series. Rodrik Greyjoy was the son and heir of [[Balon Greyjoy]], [[Lord Reaper of Pyke]]. Rodrik was killed fighting for his father in the [[Greyjoy Rebellion]].
sections.In the books:
In the ''[[A Song of Ice and Fire]]'' novels, Rodrik led a raid on the coastal castle [[Seagard]] during the Greyjoy Rebellion. He was killed by Lord [[Jason Mallister]] beneath the walls of Seagard.

In ''"A Clash of Kings"'' and ''"A Dance with Dragons"'' it is revealed that Rodrik and Maron used to bully Theon. Even after so many years, Theon still remembers the beating and cruel japes he suffered from them. He does not resent Lord Jason for killing Rodrik.
sections.Biography:
===Background===
Rodrik was the oldest son of [[Balon Greyjoy]] and [[Alannys Greyjoy|Alannys Harlaw]]. Balon is the head of [[House Greyjoy]], the [[Lord Reaper of Pyke]] and the [[Lord of the Iron Islands]]. After his father crowned himself [[King of the Iron Islands]] and rebelled against the Iron Throne,Â Rodrik was killed [[Battle of Seagard|fighting]] for his father in [[Seagard]]. Balon blamed [[Eddard Stark]] for his son's death.<ref>[http://viewers-guide.hbo.com/game-of-thrones/#!/guide/houses/greyjoy/ HBO viewers guide, season 2 guide to houses, House Greyjoy entry]</ref><ref>[http://viewers-guide.hbo.com/game-of-thrones/season2/#!/guide/appendix/greyjoy-rebellion/ HBO viewers guide, season 2 entry on the Greyjoy Rebellion]</ref>
